problem_text:
21.106. A first order formula φ(x) in the group language with one free variable is
said to be concise in a class C of groups if for every group G in C such that the set
Gφ of elements in G satisfying φ is finite, the subgroup φ(G) generated by Gφ is also
finite (cf. 21.105 and Archive 2.45). Is every formula with one free variable concise
in the class of residually finite groups?
M. Petschick
